ecba2273-868a-4c20-8a2c-6c62d86c2388.description: Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification is designed to provide a fundamental working knowledge of continuous improvement (CI) methodology and Lean Six Sigma (LSS) techniques used for CI project work. The specific skills learned and developed in this class can be applied to any career or pursuit. Students who attend yellow belt training lend support to the process improvement projects as either a project leader or as a team member.
ecba2273-868a-4c20-8a2c-6c62d86c2388.name: Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Attend classroom sessions. Participate with open, honest discussion. Complete individual assignments from class. Participate in case studies. Pass exam at the end of the session.

skills.name: Apply DMAIC/PDCA/JDI project management methodology to their events, initiatives and everyday work.
Explain and apply the fundamental principles of continuous improvement via Lean Six Sigma.
Implement continuous improvement projects in order to maximize return on investment.
Implement measurement and analysis techniques to understand the root causes of failures, waste and increased cost drivers.
Optimize resource allocation with a focus on everyday activities.
Work with cross functional teams to drive out process waste and variation in a sustainable manner.

990db839-26dc-4005-b0eb-17b359510eb6.description: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification attendees will explore advanced Lean Six Sigma tools and techniques to grow process improvement skills and become a Certified Lean Six Sigma Green Belt. They will discover how to minimize waste, streamline processes and increase efficiency by mastering essential and advanced Lean Six Sigma tools and methods.
990db839-26dc-4005-b0eb-17b359510eb6.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Participants are required to attend all sessions. Participate with open, honest discussion. Work with team members on assignments in and out of class. Complete individual assignments from class. Participate in case studies. Pass exam at the end of the session.

skills.name: Apply DMAIC/DMADV/IDDOV/PDCA/JDI project management methodology to initiatives and everyday work.
Construct and interpret designed experiments to increase revenue and market share.
Develop systems to work on in order to enable team members to work in them.
Explain and apply the fundamental principles of continuous improvement via Lean Six Sigma.
Implement measurement and analysis techniques to understand the root causes of failures, waste and increased cost drivers.
Participants must have completed yellow belt training prior to green belt and must attend all sessions in order to earn Green Belt certification.

d09f53f4-f545-4973-9260-49fa87b29158.description: Learners who complete the Essentials of Gathering Insights course offered by Dr. Larry Mallak and Mr. Jonathan Rees of Western Michigan University earn the EGI badge. The badge represents accomplishment of key EGI skills in a workshop setting.
d09f53f4-f545-4973-9260-49fa87b29158.name: Essentials of Gathering Insights

badge_template_activities.title: Criteria for evaluating learner performance for the EGI badge are: (1) Understand the importance of Empathic Design in a culture of innovation. (2) Learn how to conduct an ethnographic interview. (3) Demonstrate and critique a live interview. (4) View interviews from an ethnographic perspective. (5) Gain experience in gathering insights from interviews.

skills.name: Customer Insights
empathic design
ethnographic interviewing
Field Work
Participant Observation

ffb937d2-d410-47da-ae23-7e99f7563545.description: Agile is a shared leadership model based on decentralized decision making. Agile enables organizations and teams the ability to deliver value quickly in a variety of settings such as product and process development. Having an Agile mindset matters because this is the heart of deep collaboration. We can't just tell people to collaborate. Instead, we need to think differently. Agile is also about working smarter, rather than harder. It’s about generating more value with less work.
ffb937d2-d410-47da-ae23-7e99f7563545.name: Agile Ways of Working

badge_template_activities.title: This focused learning will result in an Agile Ways of Working Badge.

skills.name: Apply frameworks, tools, and techniques in non-technical settings
Define Agile roles & responsibilities
Describe the history & mindset of Agile

17870c7e-902f-465c-b783-3cd2bd85dab2.description: Learn key techniques and processes necessary to support productive organizational change. The program provides participants with an understanding of the role that managers and change leaders can play in guiding sustainable organizational change while avoiding common pitfalls. Frameworks and models of change are explored to promote an understanding of the processes to create and support optimal change outcomes. Appropriate for both profit and non-profit enterprises.
17870c7e-902f-465c-b783-3cd2bd85dab2.name: Change Management

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of this course will result in a credential and digital badge.

skills.name: Acquire new knowledge about the influence of multiple intelligences and culture on change leadership.
Appreciate the effect of regulative, normative and cognitive change drivers.
Learn about the key techniques and processes necessary to support productive organizational change.
Understand how to avoid common change management mistakes.

8711ee56-3aa3-425d-858c-1b5ca8b612f6.description: Lean Six Sigma Orange Belt Certification is designed to provide a working knowledge of continuous improvement (CI) methodology and Lean Six Sigma (LSS) techniques used for CI implementation and project management. While the specific skills learned are critical to marketing and sales professionals, the broader skills of critical thinking, initiatives management, empirical reasoning and interpersonal skills, among others, that are developed in this class can be applied to any career or pursuit.
8711ee56-3aa3-425d-858c-1b5ca8b612f6.name: Lean Six Sigma Orange Belt Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will be required to: Attend classroom sessions. Participate with open, honest discussion. Work with team members on assignments in and out of class. Complete individual assignments from class. Participate in the purchase experience tour. Participate in case studies. Pass exam at the end of the session.

skills.name: Apply critical thinking and mapping techniques to clarify complex marketplace settings and issues.
Apply DMAIC/PDCA/JDI project management methodology to events, initiatives and everyday work.
Construct and interpret designed experiments to increase revenue and market-share.
Explain and apply the fundamental principles of continuous improvement via Lean Six Sigma.
Identify common critical characteristics of consumers in the marketplace.
Identify common purchase experience elements and the subsequent buying behaviors they drive.
Implement continuous improvement projects in order to maximize return on investment.
Implement measurement and analysis techniques to understand the root causes of failures, waste and increased cost drivers.
Optimize resource allocation with a focus on marketing and sales activities.

74450d0c-5fbf-44f8-b2a0-a2529135921d.description: Lean Six Sigma (LSS) is a methodology used to develop a deep understanding of the leadership role within a LSS organization. White Belt training is geared toward providing leaders with fundamental comprehension of the LSS outline involving process improvement, variability, process performance and the specific roles that different team members play in order to maximize the return on investment and return on objectives.
74450d0c-5fbf-44f8-b2a0-a2529135921d.name: Lean Six Sigma White Belt Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will be required to: Attend classroom sessions. Participate with open, honest discussion. Complete individual assignments from class. Participate in case studies. Pass exam at the end of the session.

skills.name: Apply critical thinking and mapping techniques to clarify complex marketplace settings and issues.
Apply DMAIC/PDCA/JDI project management methodology to initiatives and everyday work.
Develop the principles and purpose elements that define the Shingo culture.
Explain and apply the fundamental principles of continuous improvement via LSS.
Support implementation of measurement and analysis techniques to understand the root causes of failures, waste and increased cost drivers.
Support the implementation of continuous improvement projects in order to maximize return on investment and return on objectives.
Use the coaching Kata in order to drive employee empowerment.
